experience.title: Engineer
experience.description: Tasks: HopShop is a mobile application that revolutionizes the shopping experience by allowing users to find and purchase products using only the image of the product. The task for the HopShop project was to migrate the existing non-scalable product to the cloud, enabling scalability and independent management of each component of the application. The objective was to adopt a cloud-native approach, leveraging cloud services and technologies to optimize the application's performance and flexibility.   Results: The migration of the HopShop application to the cloud and adoption of a cloud-native approach yielded several significant outcomes:  ● Terraform Implementation: By utilizing Terraform as an infrastructure-as-code tool, the project successfully tracked and managed the cloud infrastructure. This approach facilitated infrastructure provisioning, modification, and version control, harnessing the benefits of infrastructure as code.  ● Cloud-Native Scalability: The adoption of a cloud-native approach enabled the creation of a scalable system. The application architecture leveraged cloud services and technologies, allowing each component to scale independently based on the workload. This dynamic scalability ensured optimal performance and efficient resource utilization.  ● Dynamic Cost Model: The cloud-native design of the HopShop application incorporated a cost-effective approach. The system leveraged cloud provider capabilities to generate costs based on resource consumption. This allowed for a flexible cost model, ensuring efficient resource allocation and cost optimization. ● Disaster Recovery: Robust disaster recovery mechanisms were implemented to minimize downtime and ensure business continuity. The infrastructure was designed to support quick recovery and redeployment with minimal disruption in case of failures or disasters. This approach enhanced the application's resilience and reduced the impact of potential outages.  ● Reduced Maintenance Efforts and Costs: By leveraging cloud services managed by the cloud providers, the HopShop project achieved significant reductions in maintenance time and budget. The cloud services abstracted the underlying infrastructure management, allowing the team to focus on application development and functionality.  ● Scalable Infrastructure: The migration to the cloud facilitated the creation of a scalable infrastructure. The system could dynamically scale resources based on the load and demand on specific segments of the application. This scalability ensured that the application could handle increased traffic and effectively meet user demands.  ● - Enhanced Security: The migration to the cloud offered advanced security features and built-in compliance measures provided by cloud service providers. This included encryption, access controls, and robust security frameworks, ensuring the protection of sensitive data and mitigating security risks.  ● - Global Availability: The cloud-native approach allowed for easy deployment of the HopShop application in multiple regions around the world. This enabled global availability, ensuring that users from various geographic locations could access and utilize the application without latency or accessibility issues.  ● - Monitoring and Analytics: The cloud infrastructure enabled comprehensive monitoring and analytics capabilities. The project could gather real-time insights into application performance, user behavior, and system health, allowing for proactive issue identification and optimization of the application.
